articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile hit a civilian vessel carrying grain from Ukraine that had already left Ukrainian waters in the Black Sea, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian missile hit civilian ship carrying Ukrainian grain in Black Sea, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Georgia judge on Thursday dismissed two criminal counts in the U.S. state's 2020 election interference case against Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and one other count against allies of the former president.
articles.title: Georgia judge dismisses two criminal counts against Trump, court filing shows

articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that the West would be directly fighting with Russia if it allowed Ukraine to strike Russian territory with Western-made long-range missiles, a move he said would alter the nature and scope of the conflict.
articles.title: Putin says West will be fighting directly with Russia if it lets Kyiv use long-range missiles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday that more pressure should be put on Hamas to accept a new Gaza deal proposal, after the Palestinian militant group said it was only willing to implement a ceasefire free of new conditions.
articles.title: World must pressure Hamas on Gaza deal, Netanyahu says after group's statement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military on Thursday named nine men it said were Hamas militants killed in Gaza airstrikes that the U.N. Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA said had left six of its staffers dead.
articles.title: Israel names Hamas gunmen it says were targeted in strike that killed UNRWA staff

articles.author: Diadie Ba
articles.description: Senegal President Bassirou Diomaye Faye on Thursday dissolved the opposition-led national assembly, clearing the way for early legislative elections on Nov. 17.
articles.title: Senegal's president sets parliament election on Nov. 17

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: At Beijing's largest antiques market, Panjiayuan, among the Mao statues, posters and second-hand books are prominent signs warning against the sale of publications that might have state secrets or "reactionary propaganda".
articles.title: China wants academic exchange but historians say increased censorship makes research hard

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: When Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas travels to New York for the annual gathering of world leaders at the United Nations this month, he will for the first time be seated on the floor of the General Assembly among other U.N. member states.
articles.title: Could the the Palestinians become a full UNGA member?

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris leads Republican Donald Trump 47% to 42% in the race to win the Nov. 5 presidential election, increasing her advantage after a debate against the former president that voters largely think she won, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Thursday.
articles.title: Harris widens lead over Trump; voters say she won the debate: poll

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg will take over from German diplomat Christoph Heusgen as chair of the Munich Security Conference, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: NATO's Stoltenberg to chair Munich Security Conference, says source
